references.reason: This paper introduces Phi-4, which is used in this study as one of the open-source models evaluated for its physics problem-solving capabilities.

references.paper_title: Training verifiers to solve math word problems
references.reason: This paper introduces GSM8K which is mentioned as an early dataset, assessed elementary to undergraduate-level problem solving, but current state-of-the-art models now achieve near-perfect performance on these.

references.paper_title: HARDMATH: A benchmark dataset for challenging problems in applied mathematics
references.reason: This paper introduces HARDMATH, mentioned as a more advanced benchmark, introduced university and olympiad-level problems, further pushing model capabilities.

references.paper_title: Measuring mathematical problem solving with the MATH dataset
references.reason: This paper introduces MATH, mentioned as an early dataset, assessed elementary to undergraduate-level problem solving, but current state-of-the-art models now achieve near-perfect performance on these.
This paper introduces Qwen2.5, used in this study to evaluate for its physics problem-solving capabilities.
